events.originalText: Two mudslides in Badakhshan Province, Afghanistan, killed at least 350 people.
events.subtitle: 2014 Badakhshan mudslides
events.headline: 350 killed in mudslides in Badakhshan Province, Afghanistan

events.originalText: Russo-Ukrainian War: Forty-eight people were killed during a confrontation between pro-Russian protesters and pro-Ukrainian unity protesters in the southern Ukrainian port city of Odesa.
events.subtitle: Russo-Ukrainian War
events.headline: 48 killed in Russo-Ukrainian War clash in Odesa

events.originalText: The Conservative Party of Canada won enough seats in the federal election to establish their first majority government.
events.subtitle: Conservative Party of Canada
events.headline: Conservative Party of Canada wins majority government

events.originalText: Osama bin Laden was shot and killed by U.S. Navy SEAL Team 6 in a private residential compound in Abbottabad, Pakistan.
events.subtitle: Osama bin Laden
events.headline: Osama bin Laden shot and killed in Abbottabad, Pakistan

events.originalText: The Chaitén volcano in Chile began to erupt for the first time since around 1640.
events.subtitle: Chaitén (volcano)
events.headline: Chaitén volcano erupts in Chile after centuries

events.originalText: Cyclone Manou formed in the Indian Ocean; over the next two weeks it struck Madagascar and left more than 100,000 people homeless.
events.subtitle: Cyclone Manou
events.headline: Cyclone Manou leaves 100,000 homeless in Madagascar

events.originalText: Mireya Moscoso became the first woman to be elected President of Panama.
events.subtitle: Mireya Moscoso
events.headline: Mireya Moscoso elected first female President of Panama

events.originalText: Croatian War of Independence: Serb forces began rocket attacks on the Croatian capital Zagreb, killing 7 people and injuring around 200 others.
events.subtitle: Croatian War of Independence
events.headline: Serb forces attack Zagreb, killing 7 in Croatian War of Independence

events.originalText: Falklands War: HMS Conqueror sank the Argentine cruiser General Belgrano (pictured), the only ship ever to have been deliberately sunk by a nuclear submarine in battle.
events.subtitle: Falklands War
events.headline: HMS Conqueror sinks Argentine cruiser General Belgrano in Falklands War

events.originalText: Vietnam War: An explosion caused by Viet Cong commandos led USNS Card to sink in the port of Saigon.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Viet Cong explosion sinks USNS Card in Saigon port

events.originalText: World War II: General Helmuth Weidling, the German commander of Berlin, surrendered to Soviet forces led by Marshal Georgy Zhukov, ending the Battle of Berlin.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German commander of Berlin surrenders, ending Battle of Berlin

events.originalText: The Treaty of Wuchale was signed, ending the Italo-Ethiopian War, but differences in translation later led to another war.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Wuchale
events.headline: Treaty of Wuchale signed, leading to Italo-Ethiopian War

events.originalText: A dust explosion at the world's largest flour mill in Minneapolis resulted in 18 deaths.
events.subtitle: Great Mill Disaster
events.headline: 18 dead in dust explosion at Minneapolis flour mill

events.originalText: A royal charter granted the Hudson's Bay Company a monopoly in the fur trade in Rupert's Land (present-day Canada).
events.subtitle: Royal charter
events.headline: Hudson's Bay Company granted fur trade monopoly in Rupert's Land

events.originalText: Presbyterian clergyman John Knox returned from exile to lead the Scottish Reformation.
events.subtitle: Presbyterianism
events.headline: John Knox returns to lead Scottish Reformation

events.originalText: King Richard I of England gave the city of Portsmouth (Old Portsmouth pictured) its first royal charter.
events.subtitle: Richard I of England
events.headline: King Richard I grants royal charter to Portsmouth
